replies.body: Just because it's "in vanilla Minecraft" — bear in mind that Avicus gameplay is largely vanilla as well — doesn't mean it's not a glitch, because it still very much is. I believe you're talking about what's commonly denoted as the "fence glitch"... yeah, it isn't allowed. If at all punished, you'd most likely be warned or kicked for "abusing glitches"; banned, probably not (at first).

replies.body:
On a note of glitches: Would the "shoot through corners" thing count as a glitch?

Basically, it's when someone's made a wall quickly (like in JKawesome's videos when he covers himself around a monument), but if the person moves towards one corner, then part of their body will stick out and be able to get shot (I've killed a rusher who surrounded himself on Quintus before this way.)

replies.body:
I'm no staff but, I read the rules.

Section A8
"Do not intentionally take advantage of server exploits that give you an advantage of other players. Doing so results in a severe punishment. Instead, we highly encourage you to email support@avicus.net with details regarding the potential server exploit."

Notice how it says "Server Exploits"
This glitch is not because of the fault of the Avicus server, it is because of Minecraft's programming. So, unless the rules are to be updated, I believe it is allowed.
